전투 I (기본)

COMBAT I (BASICS)

전투 진행 방법

HOW COMBAT WORKS

전투 I cyclical; everybody acts in turn in a regular cycle of rounds. 전투 follows this sequence:

1. Each combatant starts out flat-footed. Once a combatant acts, he or she is no longer flat-footed.

2. Determine which characters are aware of their opponents at the start of the battle. If some but not all of the combatants are aware of their opponents, a 기습 round happens before regular rounds of 전투 begin. The combatants who are aware of the opponents can act in the 기습 round, so they roll for 선제권. In 선제권 order (highest to lowest), combatants who started the battle aware of their opponents each take one action (either a standard action or a 이동 action) during the 기습 round. Combatants who were unaware do not get to act in the 기습 round. If no one or everyone starts the battle aware, there is no 기습 round.

3. Combatants who have not yet rolled 선제권 do so. All combatants are now 준비 to begin their first regular round of 전투.

4. Combatants act in 선제권 order (highest to lowest).

5. When everyone has had a turn, the combatant with the highest 선제권 acts again, and steps 4 and 5 repeat until 전투 ends.

전투 수치

COMBAT STATISTICS

This section summarizes the statistics that determine success in 전투, and then details how to use

명중 굴림

ATTACK ROLL

An 명중 굴림 represents your attempt to strike your opponent on your turn in a round. When you make an 명중 굴림, you roll a d20 and add your 공격 보너스. (Other modifiers may also apply to this roll.) If your result equals or beats the target’s 방어도, you hit and deal 피해.

Automatic Misses and Hits: A natural 1 (the d20 comes up 1) on an 명중 굴림 is always a miss. A natural 20 (the d20 comes up 20) is always a hit. A natural 20 is also a threat—a possible critical hit.

공격 보너스

ATTACK BONUS

Your 공격 보너스 with a melee weapon is:

Base 공격 보너스 + 근력 modifier + size modifier

With a ranged weapon, your 공격 보너스 is:

Base 공격 보너스 + 민첩 modifier + size modifier + 거리 penalty

피해

DAMAGE

When your 공격 succeeds, you deal 피해. The type of weapon used determines the amount of 피해 you deal. Effects that modify weapon 피해 apply to unarmed strikes and the natural physical 공격 forms of creatures.

피해 reduces a target’s current 히트 포인트.

Minimum 피해: If penalties reduce the 피해 result to less than 1, a hit still deals 1 point of 피해.

근력 Bonus: When you hit with a melee or thrown weapon, including a sling, add your 근력 modifier to the 피해 result. A 근력 penalty, but not a bonus, applies on 공격 made with a bow that is not a composite bow.

Off-Hand Weapon: When you deal 피해 with a weapon in your off hand, you add only 1/2 your 근력 bonus.

Wielding a Weapon Two-Handed: When you deal 피해 with a weapon that you are wielding two-handed, you add 1-1/2 times your 근력 bonus. However, you don’t get this higher 근력 bonus when using a 빛 weapon with two hands.

곱하기 피해: Sometimes you multiply 피해 by some factor, such as on a critical hit. Roll the 피해 (with all modifiers) multiple times and total the results. Note: When you multiply 피해 more than once, each multiplier works off the original, unmultiplied 피해.

Exception: Extra 피해 주사위 over and above a weapon’s normal 피해 are never multiplied.

Ability 피해: Certain creatures and magical effects can cause temporary ability 피해 (a reduction to an ability score).

방어도

ARMOR CLASS

Your 방어도 (AC) represents how hard it is for opponents to land a solid, damaging blow on you. It’s the 명중 굴림 result that an opponent needs to achieve to hit you. Your AC is equal to the following: 10 + 갑옷 bonus + 방패 bonus + 민첩 modifier + size modifier

Note that 갑옷 limits your 민첩 bonus, so if you’re wearing 갑옷, you might not be able to apply your whole 민첩 bonus to your AC.

Sometimes you can’t use your 민첩 bonus (if you have one). If you can’t react to a blow, you can’t use your 민첩 bonus to AC. (If you don’t have a 민첩 bonus, nothing happens.)

Other Modifiers: Many other factors modify your AC.

Enhancement Bonuses: Enhancement effects make your 갑옷 better.

Deflection Bonus: Magical deflection effects ward off 공격 and improve your AC.

Natural 갑옷: Natural 갑옷 improves your AC.

회피 Bonuses: Some other AC bonuses represent actively avoiding blows. These bonuses are called 회피 bonuses. Any situation that denies you your 민첩 bonus also denies you 회피 bonuses. (Wearing 갑옷, however, does not limit these bonuses the way it limits a 민첩 bonus to AC.) Unlike most sorts of bonuses, 회피 bonuses stack with each other.

Touch 공격: Some 공격 disregard 갑옷, including 방패 and natural 갑옷. In these cases, the attacker makes a touch 명중 굴림 (either ranged or melee). When you are the target of a touch 공격, your AC doesn’t include any 갑옷 bonus, 방패 bonus, or natural 갑옷 bonus. All other modifiers, such as your size modifier, 민첩 modifier, and deflection bonus (if any) apply normally.

히트 포인트

HIT POINTS

When your hit point total reaches 0, you’re 행동 불능. When it reaches –1, you’re 죽어가고 있음. When it gets to –10, you’re 죽음.

속도

SPEED

Your 속도 tells you how far you can 이동 in a round and still do something, such as 공격 or 주문 시전. Your 속도 depends mostly on your race and what 갑옷 you’re wearing.

드워프, 노움, and 하플링 have a 속도 of 20 feet (4 squares), or 15 feet (3 squares) when wearing medium or heavy 갑옷 (except for 드워프, who 이동 20 feet in any 갑옷).

인간, 엘프, 하프 엘프, and 하프 오크 have a 속도 of 30 feet (6 squares), or 20 feet (4 squares) in medium or heavy 갑옷.

If you use two 이동 행동 in a round (sometimes called a “double 이동” action), you can 이동 up to double your 속도. If you spend the entire round to 달리기 all out, you can 이동 up to quadruple your 속도 (or triple if you are in heavy 갑옷).

내성 굴림

SAVING THROWS

Generally, when you are subject to an unusual or magical 공격, you get a 내성 굴림 to avoid or reduce the effect. Like an 명중 굴림, a 내성 굴림 is a d20 roll plus a bonus based on your class, 레벨, and an ability score. Your 내성 굴림 modifier is: Base save bonus + ability modifier

내성 굴림 Types: The three different kinds of 내성 굴림 are Fortitude, Reflex, and Will:

Fortitude: These 내성 굴림 measure your ability to 일어서기 to physical punishment or 공격 against your vitality and health. Apply your 건강 modifier to your Fortitude 내성 굴림.

Reflex: These 내성 굴림 test your ability to 회피 범위 공격. Apply your 민첩 modifier to your Reflex 내성 굴림.

Will: These 내성 굴림 reflect your 저항 to mental influence as well as many magical effects. Apply your 지혜 modifier to your Will 내성 굴림.

내성 굴림 난이도 등급: The DC for a save is determined by the 공격 itself.

Automatic Failures and Successes: A natural 1 (the d20 comes up 1) on a 내성 굴림 is always a failure (and may cause 피해 to exposed items; see Items Surviving after a 내성 굴림). A natural 20 (the d20 comes up 20) is always a success.

선제권

INITIATIVE

선제권 Checks: At the start of a battle, each combatant makes an 선제권 check. An 선제권 check is a 민첩 check. Each character applies his or her 민첩 modifier to the roll. Characters act in order, counting down from highest result to lowest. In every round that follows, the characters act in the same order (unless a character takes an action that results in his or her 선제권 changing; see 특수 선제권 행동).

If two or more combatants have the same 선제권 check result, the combatants who are tied act in order of total 선제권 modifier (highest first). If there is still a tie, the tied characters should roll again to determine which one of them goes before the other.

Flat-Footed: At the start of a battle, before you have had a chance to act (specifically, before your first regular turn in the 선제권 order), you are flat-footed. You can’t use your 민첩 bonus to AC (if any) while flat-footed. 바바리안 and 도적 have the uncanny 회피 extraordinary ability, which allows them to avoid losing their 민첩 bonus to AC due to being flat-footed.

A flat-footed character can’t make 기회 공격.

Inaction: Even if you can’t take actions, you retain your 선제권 score for the 지속시간 of the encounter.

기습

SURPRISE

When a 전투 starts, if you are not aware of your opponents and they are aware of you, you’re surprised.

Determining Awareness

Sometimes all the combatants on a side are aware of their opponents, sometimes none are, and sometimes only some of them are. Sometimes a few combatants on each side are aware and the other combatants on each side are unaware.

Determining awareness may call for 듣기 checks, 감지 checks, or other checks.

The 기습 Round: If some but not all of the combatants are aware of their opponents, a 기습 round happens before regular rounds begin. Any combatants aware of the opponents can act in the 기습 round, so they roll for 선제권. In 선제권 order (highest to lowest), combatants who started the battle aware of their opponents each take a standard action during the 기습 round. You can also take 자유 행동 during the 기습 round. If no one or everyone is surprised, no 기습 round occurs.

Unaware Combatants: Combatants who are unaware at the start of battle don’t get to act in the 기습 round. Unaware combatants are flat-footed because they have not acted yet, so they lose any 민첩 bonus to AC.

기회 공격

ATTACKS OF OPPORTUNITY

Sometimes a combatant in a melee lets her guard down. In this case, combatants near her can take advantage of her lapse in defense to 공격 her for free. These free 공격 are called 기회 공격.

Threatened Squares: You threaten all squares into which you can make a melee 공격, even when it is not your action. Generally, that means everything in all squares adjacent to your space (including diagonally). An enemy that takes certain actions while in a threatened square provokes an 공격 of opportunity from you. If you’re unarmed, you don’t normally threaten any squares and thus can’t make 기회 공격.

Reach 무기: Most creatures of Medium or smaller size have a reach of only 5 feet. This means that they can make melee 공격 only against creatures up to 5 feet (1 square) away. However, Small and Medium creatures wielding reach 무기 threaten more squares than a typical creature. In addition, most creatures larger than Medium have a natural reach of 10 feet or more.

Provoking an 공격 of Opportunity: Two kinds of actions can provoke 기회 공격: moving out of a threatened square and performing an action within a threatened square.

Moving: Moving out of a threatened square usually provokes an 공격 of opportunity from the threatening opponent. There are two common methods of avoiding such an 공격—the 5-foot-step and the 퇴각 action (see below).

Performing a Distracting Act: Some actions, when performed in a threatened square, provoke 기회 공격 as you divert your attention from the battle. Table: 전투 내 행동 notes many of the actions that provoke 기회 공격.

Remember that even actions that normally provoke 기회 공격 may have exceptions to this rule.

Making an 공격 of Opportunity: An 공격 of opportunity is a single melee 공격, and you can only make one per round. You don’t have to make an 공격 of opportunity if you don’t want to.

An experienced character gets additional regular melee 공격 (by using the 전력 공격 action), but at a lower 공격 보너스. You make your 공격 of opportunity, however, at your normal 공격 보너스—even if you’ve already attacked in the round.

An 공격 of opportunity “interrupts” the normal flow of actions in the round. If an 공격 of opportunity is provoked, immediately resolve the 공격 of opportunity, then continue with the next character’s turn (or complete the current turn, if the 공격 of opportunity was provoked in the midst of a character’s turn).

전투 반사 and Additional 기회 공격: If you have the 전투 반사 feat you can add your 민첩 modifier to the number of 기회 공격 you can make in a round. This feat does not let you make more than one 공격 for a given opportunity, but if the same opponent provokes two 기회 공격 from you, you could make two separate 기회 공격 (since each one represents a different opportunity). Moving out of more than one square threatened by the same opponent in the same round doesn’t count as more than one opportunity for that opponent. All these 공격 are at your full normal 공격 보너스.

전투 내 행동

ACTIONS IN COMBAT

전투 라운드

THE COMBAT ROUND

Each round represents 6 seconds in the game world. A round presents an opportunity for each character involved in a 전투 situation to take an action.

Each round’s activity begins with the character with the highest 선제권 result and then proceeds, in order, from there. Each round of a 전투 uses the same 선제권 order. When a character’s turn comes up in the 선제권 sequence, that character 공연 his entire round’s worth of actions. (For exceptions, see 기회 공격 and 특수 선제권 행동.)

For almost all 목적, there is no relevance to the end of a round or the beginning of a round. A round can be a segment of game time starting with the first character to act and ending with the last, but it usually means a span of time from one round to the same 선제권 count in the next round. Effects that last a certain number of rounds end just before the same 선제권 count that they began on.

행동 유형

ACTION TYPES

An action’s type essentially tells you how long the action takes to 공연 (within the framework of the 6-second 전투 round) and how 이동 is treated. There are four types of actions: 표준 행동, 이동 행동, 전체 라운드 행동, and 자유 행동.

In a normal round, you can 공연 a standard action and a 이동 action, or you can 공연 a full-round action. You can also 공연 one or more 자유 행동. You can always take a 이동 action in place of a standard action.

In some situations (such as in a 기습 round), you may be limited to taking only a single 이동 action or standard action.

Standard Action: A standard action allows you to do something, most commonly make an 공격 or 주문 시전. See Table: 전투 내 행동 for other 표준 행동.

이동 Action: A 이동 action allows you to 이동 your 속도 or 공연 an action that takes a similar amount of time. See Table: 전투 내 행동.

You can take a 이동 action in place of a standard action. If you 이동 no actual distance in a round (commonly because you have swapped your 이동 for one or more equivalent actions), you can take one 5-foot step either before, during, or after the action.

Full-Round Action: A full-round action consumes all your effort during a round. The only 이동 you can take during a full-round action is a 5-foot step before, during, or after the action. You can also 공연 자유 행동 (see below).

Some 전체 라운드 행동 do not allow you to take a 5-foot step.

Some 전체 라운드 행동 can be taken as 표준 행동, but only in situations when you are limited to performing only a standard action during your round. The 묘사 of specific actions, below, detail which actions allow this option.

Free Action: 자유 행동 consume a very small amount of time and effort. You can 공연 one or more 자유 행동 while taking another action normally. However, there are reasonable limits on what you can really do for free.

Not an Action: Some activities are so minor that they are not even considered 자유 행동. They literally don’t take any time at all to do and are considered an inherent part of doing something else.

Restricted Activity: In some situations, you may be unable to take a full round’s worth of actions. In such cases, you are restricted to taking only a single standard action or a single 이동 action (plus 자유 행동 as normal). You can’t take a full-round action (though you can start or complete a full-round action by using a standard action; see below).

표준 행동

STANDARD ACTIONS
공격
Attack

Making an 공격 is a standard action.

Melee 공격: With a normal melee weapon, you can strike any opponent within 5 feet. (Opponents within 5 feet are considered adjacent to you.) Some melee 무기 have reach, as indicated in their 묘사. With a typical reach weapon, you can strike opponents 10 feet away, but you can’t strike adjacent foes (those within 5 feet).

Unarmed 공격: Striking for 피해 with punches, kicks, and head butts is much like attacking with a melee weapon, except for the following:

기회 공격: Attacking unarmed provokes an 공격 of opportunity from the character you 공격, provided she is armed. The 공격 of opportunity comes before your 공격. An unarmed 공격 does not provoke 기회 공격 from other foes nor does it provoke an 공격 of opportunity from an unarmed foe.

An unarmed character can’t take 기회 공격 (but see “Armed” Unarmed 공격, below).

“Armed” Unarmed 공격: Sometimes a character’s or creature’s unarmed 공격 counts as an armed 공격. A 수도사, a character with the 향상된 비무장 타격 feat, a spellcaster delivering a touch 공격 spell, and a creature with natural physical 무기 all count as being armed.

Note that being armed counts for both offense and defense (the character can make 기회 공격)

Unarmed Strike 피해: An unarmed strike from a Medium character deals 1d3 points of 피해 (plus your 근력 modifier, as normal). A Small character’s unarmed strike deals 1d2 points of 피해, while a Large character’s unarmed strike deals 1d4 points of 피해. All 피해 from unarmed strikes is 비치명적인 피해. Unarmed strikes count as 빛 무기 (for 목적 of two-weapon 공격 penalties and so on).

Dealing Lethal 피해: You can specify that your unarmed strike will deal lethal 피해 before you make your 명중 굴림, but you take a –4 penalty on your 명중 굴림. If you have the 향상된 비무장 타격 feat, you can deal lethal 피해 with an unarmed strike without taking a penalty on the 명중 굴림.

Ranged 공격: With a ranged weapon, you can shoot or throw at any target that is within the weapon’s maximum 거리 and in line of sight. The maximum 거리 for a thrown weapon is five 거리 increments. For projectile 무기, it is ten 거리 increments. Some ranged 무기 have shorter maximum 거리, as specified in their 묘사.

명중 굴림: An 명중 굴림 represents your attempts to strike your opponent.

Your 명중 굴림 is 1d20 + your 공격 보너스 with the weapon you’re using. If the result is at least as high as the target’s AC, you hit and deal 피해.

Automatic Misses and Hits: A natural 1 (the d20 comes up 1) on the 명중 굴림 is always a miss. A natural 20 (the d20 comes up 20) is always a hit. A natural 20 is also a threat—a possible critical hit.

피해 Rolls: If the 명중 굴림 result equals or exceeds the target’s AC, the 공격 hits and you deal 피해. Roll the appropriate 피해 for your weapon. 피해 is deducted from the target’s current 히트 포인트.

Multiple 공격: A character who can make more than one 공격 per round must use the 전력 공격 action (see 전체 라운드 행동, below) in order to get more than one 공격.

Shooting or Throwing into a Melee: If you shoot or throw a ranged weapon at a target engaged in melee with a friendly character, you take a –4 penalty on your 명중 굴림. Two characters are engaged in melee if they are enemies of each other and either threatens the other. (An unconscious or otherwise immobilized character is not considered engaged unless he is actually being attacked.)

If your target (or the part of your target you’re aiming at, if it’s a big target) is at least 10 feet away from the nearest friendly character, you can avoid the –4 penalty, even if the creature you’re aiming at is engaged in melee with a friendly character.

정밀 사격: If you have the 정밀 사격 feat you don’t take this penalty.

Fighting Defensively as a Standard Action: You can choose to fight defensively when attacking. If you do so, you take a –4 penalty on all 공격 in a round to gain a +2 회피 bonus to AC for the same round.
